result.execSummary:
The defendant Emmanuel M Haslett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $750 + costs = $1198 + $200 DNA Surcharge + $708.75 drug abuse surcharge + $25 drug testing fee = $2131.75, due in $35 incriments per month, beginning 9/1/14 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 86 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
1 day credit given for time served - to be applied if Mr. Haslett needs to serve alternate jail sentence for failure to pay

Bookkeeping Screenshots
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case recalled at 11:52 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Emmanuel M Haslett in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS charge to Possession of THC, contrary to 961.41(3g)(e), a Misdemeanor, striking  the 2nd or subsequesnt offense

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $750 + costs = $1198 + $200 DNA Surcharge + $708.75 drug abuse surcharge + $25 drug testing fee = $2131.75, due in $35 incriments per month, beginning 9/1/14 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 86 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
1 day credit given for time served - to be applied if Mr. Haslett needs to serve alternate jail sentence for failure to pay
Recess: 12:05 pm

Case called at 10:38 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall requests warrant
Atty De La Rosa: Do not have explanation for Defendant's non-appearance. Do have resolution to matter, requests the Court not issue warrant. 
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty De La Rosa indicates that the last contact he had with Mr. Haslett was shortly after last STC in this matter
Court presents basis and orders issuance of a bench warrant - Body Only - Court STAYS warrant until 8/1/14 at 1:30 pm, If Mr. Haslett does not appear at that time, the warrant will issue
Recess: 10:41 am 

NEXT: Reschedule STC 8/1/14 at 1:30 pm - Send notices **Atty De La Rosa on intake & may be late for this hearing**

Returned by USPS: Return to Sender/ Not deliverable as addressed/ Unable to Forward
Clerk's Note KG: The 5-22-14 Initial Appearance Minutes were edited on this date to show a correction regarding Preliminary Hearing Time Limits that were waived on the 5-22-14 date.
Status conference on July 25, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Emmanuel M Haslett in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Scheduling Notice
Defendant signed bond on 5/22/14, original bond received by COC from JCSD on 5/23/14

Case called at 1:26 pm.  

Defendant Emmanuel M Haslett in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehelk informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.
Attorney Svehelk informs the Court that the defendant does qualify for SPD representation.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB listed on the criminal complaint is correct. 
Mr. Haslett informs the Court of his current address: 1211 McAurthur Road, Madison 53704

A warrant was issued after the State was unable to service the Criminal Complaint on Mr. Haslett.
The Courts notes that Judge Nettesheim previously found Probable Cause in the Criminal Complaint.

Court requires $1,500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia 

The Court asks Attorney Svehlek to make sure defendant is booked at JESO. 
Preliminary Hearing waived by both parties. [Clerk's added note on 6-30-14: Correction is made to indicate that Preliminary Hearing Time Limits were waived by both parties.]
The Court finds the warrant to be satisfied by Mr. Haslett's appearance. It should be removed from any database in which it is entered.

Recess: 1:34 pm
